meanings.definition: Continue in a course of action even in the face of difficulty or with little or no prospect of success.
meanings.sent1: She perseverates on her homework until it is completed, no matter how challenging it gets.
meanings.sent2: He often perseverates in his efforts to learn new skills, never giving up despite setbacks.
meanings.sent3: The little ant perseverates in carrying the heavy crumb to its anthill, determined to succeed.
meanings.sent4: Like a determined marathon runner, she perseverates through the race, focused on reaching the finish line.
meanings.sent5: His dedication to his craft is evident as he perseverates through each project with unwavering determination.

meanings.definition: Repeat or prolong an action, thought, or utterance after the stimulus that prompted it has ceased.
meanings.sent1: The child perseverates on the tune of the song, humming it repeatedly throughout the day.
meanings.sent2: After watching the magic trick, he perseverates on how the magician made the coin disappear.
meanings.sent3: The parrot amusingly perseverates on mimicking the sound of the doorbell, confusing the visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her mind perseverates on the memory of his laughter, echoing in her thoughts like a haunting melody.
meanings.sent5: The idea of the upcoming vacation perseverates in his mind, bringing a smile to his face every time he thinks about it.
